Week 1.topic: Web Fundamentals: How the Internet and Web Works (HTTP, DNS, Client-Server Model)
HTML5: Semantic Structure, Common Tags, Forms, Accessibility Basics
CSS3: Selectors, Box Model, Display Properties, Positioning, Flexbox (Deep Dive)
CSS3: Grid (Introduction), Responsive Design (Media Queries, Mobile-First)
Developer Tools: Inspecting and Debugging HTML/CSS in Browser
Version Control: Git Basics (init, add, commit, push to GitHub)
Project: Build a Complex, Responsive Static Website

Week 2.topic: JavaScript Core: Variables, Data Types, Operators, Control Flow (if/else, loops)
DOM Manipulation: Selecting Elements, Creating/Modifying/Deleting Elements
DOM Manipulation: Event Listeners (click, submit, keyup)
Asynchronous JavaScript: Callbacks, Promises (Basics), `fetch` API for External Data
JSON: Working with JSON Data Structures
Modern JS Features (ES6+): Arrow Functions, Template Literals, `let`/`const`
Project: Enhance Week 1 Website with JS Interactivity (e.g., Dynamic Content, Form Validation, Simple API Data Fetching)

Week 3.topic: Node.js Basics: Setup, npm, Modules, Event Loop (Conceptual)
Express.js: Setting Up a Server, Routing, Middleware, Request/Response Objects
RESTful APIs: Principles, Common HTTP Methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
Data Persistence: Introduction to Databases (e.g., SQLite/JSON file-based DB)
Data Persistence: Basic CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) Operations with a Database
Project: Build a RESTful API with Node.js and Express.js that interacts with a Database

Week 4.topic: Full-Stack Integration: Connecting Frontend (Week 2) and Backend (Week 3) APIs
Full-Stack Integration: Handling CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing)
Frontend Framework Introduction: React (Components, JSX, Props, State, useState Hook)
Authentication Concepts: High-Level Overview of Token-Based Authentication (e.g., JWT)
Deployment Basics: Hosting Static Frontend (e.g., Netlify/Vercel)
Deployment Basics: Hosting Backend API (e.g., Render/Heroku Free Tier)
Project: Rebuild a Portion of the Week 2 Frontend using React, connect it to the Week 3 Backend API, and deploy both components.
